business.headline: Budget 2025: 5 top middle-class expectations for tax relief and savings growthExperts suggest scrapping the old tax regime and rationalising the income tax slabs under the new regime, would go a long way in making income tax simpler.

8th Pay Commission may give a 186% boost to pensions. Find out how The fitment factor plays an important role in calculating the updated pay and benefits and is likely to be in the range between 2.28 and 2.86 for the 8th Pay Commission.

Stuck in middle-income trap: Fareed Zakaria decodes China's economic crisisFareed Zakaria said that China's economy is not going to grow any time at the six, seven, eight percent that it was growing at previously.
How to achieve minimum credit score for getting personal loan? Details hereThe higher the credit score, the greater are the chances for the approval of your loan requests.

InterGlobe Aviation Q3 results: IndiGo operator's net profit falls by 18%Indigo Q3 results: The net profit for the aviation company dropped by 18% to Rs 2,449 crore when compared to Rs 2,998 crore in the same quarter a year ago.

Budget 2025: EV sector pushes for tech investments and smart mobility solutionsExperts anticipate that Budget 2025 would introduce policies that would boost EV sales across the country and help India achieve its goal of reducing carbon emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.

Sensex, Nifty fall amid volatility; energy and pharma lead lossesShare Market: The S&P BSE Sensex shed 329.92 points to close at 76,190.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.15 points to end at 23,092.20.
Amul cuts milk prices by Re 1 per litre across IndiaThe reduction will only be applicable to 1-litre packs. Previously, in June 2024, Amul had increased milk prices by Rs 2 per litre.

India-US relationship beyond personalities: Fareed Zakaria on Trump 2.0Fareed Zakaria shared his insights on the political shift in the United States and the seismic changes it is expected to bring geopolitically and economically across the world.

Adani Green Energy shares fall as Sri Lanka cancels power purchase dealAdani Green Energy shares fell after the news of Sri Lanka cancelling the power purchase deal to hit the day's low of Rs 1,008, crashing over 6% from the day's high.

Why are markets volatile, and should you be worried? 3 things to know Sensex scaled to 76,985.95, reaching the day's high, a jump of over 500 points, but was trading at 76,621.03 as of 1 PM. Nifty has also gone about in the same manner.

Why did Cyient CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan resign?The resignation of Cyient's CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan was a major reason that led to the sharp decline in the company's share price.

HUL to acquire stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore; Peak XV bags 10X gainsHUL has acquired a 90.5% stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore, making it one of the biggest acquisitions in the country's startup ecosystem.

Cyient share price falls 20% to hit 52-week low. What triggered Friday's crash?Cyient stock price: At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25.

Explained: Why Dr Reddy's share price cracked 6% in early tradeDr Reddy's Laboratories Stock Price: Dr Reddy's shares tumbled up to 6% in early trade and at 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; energy stocks gainShare Market Today, 24 January 2025: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 204.76 points to 76,725.14 at 9:17 am, while the NSE Nify50 traded 64.15 points higher at 23,269.50.

Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw says manufacturing, services, AI to drive growthAt the World Economic Forum, Minister Ashwini Vaishnav outlined India's economic strategy based on four pillars: public investment in infrastructure, focus on manufacturing and innovation, inclusive growth, and simplification of laws.

entertainment.headline: Stranger Things 5 out in November? Eagle-eyed fans spot release dateStranger Things fans may have discovered the release date for the fifth season through a Netflix code. The show will reportedly be released in November 2025.

Suits LA trailer: Stephen Amell takes you to 'west coast', Harvey Spector reappearsThe trailer of Suits LA teased actor Gabriel Macht's return as Harvey Spector in the new spin-off series. Actor Stephen Amell leads the show, which is going to be premiered next month.

Coldplay's Chris Martin enjoys scooter ride in Ahmedabad ahead of concertColdplay's Chris Martin made a memorable entrance in Ahmedabad by arriving on a scooter. The iconic rock band is scheduled to perform at the Narendra Modi Stadium on January 25 and 26.

Identity OTT release: When and where to watch Tovino Thomas, Trisha's thrillerIdentity OTT release date: The Tovino Thomas and Trisha Krishnan-starrer is set to release on Zee5. Directed by Akhil Paul and Anas Khan, the psychological thriller will begin streaming from next week.

Coldplay in India: A rollercoaster of excitement, chaos, and disappointmentColdplay's first three concerts in India have left fans with mixed feelings. While tickets for all the five shows sold out quickly, fans all over the country complained about the issues surrounding the Mumbai concerts.

Singer Chris Brown sues Warner Bros for sexual assault allegations in docuseriesSinger Chris Brown has reportedly sued Warner Bros over sexual assault allegations for a whopping $500 million.

Newtopia trailer: BLACKPINK's Jisoo to headline hilarious romantic zombie dramaThe much-anticipated trailer for Newtopia is out, featuring BLACKPINK's Jisoo and actor Park Jeong-min. The duo navigates a zombie outbreak in this gripping drama based on Han Sang-woon's novel Influenza.

Sweet Dreams movie review: Mithila-Amol's film is a candy that's not sweet enoughReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Sweet Dreams movie review: Sweet Dreams could have been a simple romantic film, but it ends up being preachy in an attempt to mildly school the young generation about the difference between dreams and reality. However, Mithila Palkar and Amol Parashar look pretty together.

BB 18 winner Karan Veer Mehra's ex-wife, actor Nidhi Seth gets marriedTwo years after separating from Karanveer Mehra, actress Nidhi Seth remarried her boyfriend Sandiip Kummar. Recently, she shared pictures from her temple wedding.

Watch: BTS' J-hope, Rose, G-Dragon and Taeyang claim the stage at Paris eventBTS member J-hope, Blackpink's Rose, and G-Dragon and Taeyang of BigBang recently marked their presence at a Paris event. J-hope even shared photos from his performance on social media.

When Life Gives You Tangerines: Park Bo-gum, IU's K-drama to premiere on this dateThe much-anticipated K-drama, When Life Gives You Tangerines, starring Park Bo-gum and IU, will premiere on Netflix on March 7. The streaming date was shared alongside the show's first teaser.

Hisaab Barabar review: R Madhavan tries hard to save this middling filmReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025Hisaab Barabar movie review: R Madhavan's latest, Hisaab Barabar, had the potential to deliver something raw and novel. Instead, the Ashwni Dhir directorial falls into the usual traps of the everyman story. Read our take on the film here.

Paatal Lok 2 ending explained: What's next for Hathi Ram, did he get Rs 2 crore?Paatal Lok 2 continues to captivate audiences with its intricate storyline and profound depiction of Nagaland's socio-political landscape. The series resolves its many mysteries, leaving viewers pondering Inspector Hathi Ram's future. Find out what the season's ending meant and whether there will be a third season of Paatal Lok.

Pics: Rapper Emiway Bantai marries singer-actor SwaalinaRapper Eminem Batai surprised fans as he shared photos from his intimate wedding ceremony with actor and singer Swaalina. The duo worked together in the 2023 music video, Kudi.

Ian Bohen on working with Salman Khan in Marigold, Yellowstone, Teen Wolf, Hollywood dreams Ian Bohen opened up in an exclusive chat about the emotional and dramatic finale season of Yellowstone and credited Teen Wolf for bolstering his self-assurance. He also spoke about Salman Khan, whom he co-starred in Marigold.

general news.headline: Sushil Modi, Sharda Sinha, PR Sreejesh conferred with Padma AwardsFormer deputy chief minister of Bihar Sushil Kumar Modi, former chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation Osamu Suzuki, and  cricketer R Ashwin are some of the other notable persons who will receive the Padma awards.

One Nation One Poll can prevent policy paralysis: President on Republic Day eveIn her 76th Republic Day eve address, President Droupadi Murmu highlighted the significance of One Nation One Election, saying it would promote consistency in governance and reduce financial burden on resources.

2nd T20I: Tilak Varma rescue act helps India win thriller in Chennai, take 2-0 leadIndia took a 2-0 lead in Chennai in the 5-match T20I series against England. Tilak Varma rescued India from troubled waters with a resilient display with the bat at the MA Chidambaram Stadium. Tilak scored 72 not out to hand India a win by 2 wickets.

4 Israeli women soldiers, captive for 477 days, released by Hamas Hamas freed four Israeli soldiers to the International Red Cross under a Gaza truce. The soldiers, held for 477 days, were displayed in uniforms in Gaza City before the handover.

FIITJEE says it didn't close Delhi, UP centres on its own, blames managing partnersAfter an FIR was lodged against the founder of FIITJEE, the organisation assured students and parents that their best interests would be prioritised.

Gig workers' welfare board, Yamuna riverfront: BJP's new promises for Delhi pollsUnion Home Minister Amit Shah announced a slew of promises, including creating a gig workers' welfare board, providing life and accidental insurances for them and cleaning the Yamuna within three years if it was voted to power in Delhi.

Alia Bhatt in micro choli and black saree stuns at '25 years of Sabyasachi' showAlia Bhatt wowed in a black saree with a statement embellished blouse at designer Sabyasachi Mukherjee's grand fashion show in Mumbai, marking 25 years of the label.

US Supreme Court clears extradition of 26/11 accused Tahawwur Rana to IndiaThe US Supreme Court has approved the extradition of Tahawwur Rana, a Canadian of Pakistani origin, to India. Rana is accused of involvement in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks targeting multiple locations.

Madison Keys denies Sabalenka Australian Open hat-trick, wins maiden Grand SlamAustralian Open 2025: Madison Keys won her maiden Grand Slam title at 30, stunning World No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka in three sets to deny the Belarusian a rare three-peat in Melbourne.

Rahul Gandhi finds special mention in AAP's list of dishonest peopleFor the first time, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's picture appears on one of AAP's posters, with the party terming him "dishonest" alongside PM Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah, and Delhi BJP leaders.

Indian audience's laal ishq: Decoding the rise of gore on big screensIndian cinema is witnessing a surge in stylised gore, captivating audiences despite the lack of family-friendly certifications. On Cinematic Saturday, actor Unni Mukundan, senior trade analyst Taran Adarsh and National Award-winning critic Deepak Dua decode what is drawing the big screen audience to gruesome films.

Yoga practitioner from Kuwait, travel blogger couple among Padma Award recipientsA Yoga practitioner from Kuwait, Shaikha AJ Al Sabah, travel blogger couple Hugh and Colleen Gantzer from Uttarakhand will be conferred with a Padma Shri award, announced the Ministry of Home Affairs.

Is Hamas back in control in Gaza within days of ceasefire?The ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war may have brought a pause to the fighting, but it has also allowed Hamas to regroup and assert its authority in Gaza. Hamas, which has recruited thousands of fighters all through the war, has redeployed police and is making a visible return to power in Gaza.

Shivam Dube to replace injured Nitish Reddy for England T20IsIndia all-rounder Shivam Dube will join India's T20I squad for the remainder of the England series as cover for injured Nitish Kumar Reddy.

Pakistan Cricket Board to test Champions Trophy venues in Karachi, LahoreThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) plans to test its newly renovated stadiums in Karachi and Lahore ahead of the upcoming Champions Trophy by hosting a tri-nation ODI series featuring South Africa and New Zealand, starting on February 8.

Arshdeep Singh named ICC men's T20I cricketer of the year for 2024India pacer Arshdeep Singh was named as the ICC men's T20I cricketer of the year for 2024. Arshdeep won the award after a sensational performance in the last 12 months, where he bagged 36 wickets in just 18 games.

WPL 2025: RCB's Sophie Devine to miss third season after taking breakSophie Devine will be missing the WPL 2025 season for Royal Challengers Bengaluru after the all-rounder decided to take a break. Devine played a big role in RCB's title-winning campaign last year.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.
